meanings.definition: Of or relating to a category of literature considered to be of lesser quality or importance than traditional literary works.
meanings.sent1: The subliterary novel was not well-received by critics.
meanings.sent2: Her subliterary writing style lacked depth and originality.
meanings.sent3: The subliterary poem made everyone chuckle at its simplicity.
meanings.sent4: His subliterary prose was like a dull painting in a gallery of masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The subliterary story was forgettable and uninspiring.

meanings.definition: Writing or works that are considered to be of a lower standard or quality compared to mainstream literature.
meanings.sent1: The library had a section dedicated to subliterary works.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading subliterary novels for a change of pace.
meanings.sent3: The subliterary play was a comedic relief in the midst of serious dramas.
meanings.sent4: His collection of subliterary books was like a hidden treasure trove.
meanings.sent5: The professor dismissed subliterary writings as mere entertainment.
